data.title: Bonnie Sheridan
data.text:
If my eyes and ears are not playing tricks on me, I believe Bonnie Sheridan

used to be Bonnie Bramlett, when she was married to Delaney Bramlett.

They had a band (in the 70s?) called "Delaney and Bonnie". They released an

album titled "Delaney and Bonnie & Friends" where the "Friends" were

Eric Clapton and some others I don't recall at the moment. This was while

Clapton was going through his recovery from the many substances he was abusing

at the time. Working with this band he regained his ability to get on stage,

and improved his skills to the point that he became a front man in the

solo career that followed. In fact, the singing style that emerged bears a

strong resemblance to that of Delaney.

"D&B" were a fairly mediocre band, but it was interesting to see them on

tour with Eric in tow (and I did).

Is Bonnie getting into a rut? First, she helps Clapton back to reality,

and now she's partnered with David Crosby (at least on TV) who himself

recently returned from the land of the dead.
